question_title: What will be the value of "ICE BofA Euro High Yield Index Option-Adjusted Spread" on 2026-02-12?
summary: The Euro HY OAS currently stands at 2.64% (Jan 31, 2026), near historical tights. Over the ~8 trading days to resolution (Feb 12), I expect the spread to remain near current levels with slight positive skew reflecting asymmetric risk: limited room for further compression at tights, but tail risk for widening from geopolitical shocks or risk-off events. The ECB meets Feb 4-5 but is expected to hold rates (~90% probability). The distribution is right-skewed with median around 2.67% and fat tails for potential widening scenarios.

factors.description: Current spread at 2.64% - near historical tights provides anchor point with limited compression room
Short time horizon (8 trading days) limits expected volatility and drift from current levels
Spreads near all-time tights create asymmetric risk profile - widening potential exceeds compression potential
ECB meeting Feb 4-5 before resolution - likely hold but adds minor uncertainty
Geopolitical tail risks (Ukraine, trade tensions) could trigger sudden widening
Low default rates (~3%) and healthy fundamentals support current tight spreads
Status quo bias - credit spreads tend to be sticky over short periods absent shocks
